displayTargetSetting.title: Set item(s) to be displayed
displayTargetSetting.label: Displayed items
displayTargetSetting.info.displayTargetSetting: Select Display to display items on the tab of the detailed screen.

label.activityLinkedField: Items to be reflected to Activity

layoutNumberic.label: Default value
layoutNumberic.label.formatDecimal: Number of digits after the decimal point

layoutSelect.filter.title: Filter
layoutSelect.label.condition: Process when multiple options are selected

layoutDateTime.label.dayBeforeAfter: From a past date to a future date
layoutDateTime.label.monthBeforeAfter: From a past month to a future month

layoutCalculation.calculate_sum_two_values: Calculate the sum of two values.
layoutCalculation.calculate_sub_two_values: Calculate the difference between two values.
layoutCalculation.mutilply_by_power: Multiply the number by a specified number of powers.
layoutCalculation.specifies_expression_with_bracket: The fomula enclosed in brackets will be calculated first. Other fomulas will be calculated in standard precedences.
layoutCalculation.calculate_absolute_value: Calculate the absolute value of the number. An absolute value of a number is the number without the positive or negative mark on it.
layoutCalculation.upto_whole_number: Round up to the nearest integer (further from 0 if negative).
layoutCalculation.e_multiply_by_exponent: Return the value of e multiplied by the specified exponent.
layoutCalculation.downto_whole_number: Round down to the nearest integer (closer to 0 if negative).
layoutCalculation.natural_logarit: Return the natural logarithm of the specified number. Natural logarithm is based on the value of the constant e 2.71828182845904.
layoutCalculation.logarit_base10: Return the base 10 logarithm of a number.
layoutCalculation.max_of_list: Return the highest number in a list of numbers.
layoutCalculation.upto_whole_number1: Round up to the nearest integer (further from 0 if negative).
layoutCalculation.downto_whole_number1: Round down to the nearest integer (further from 0 if negative).
layoutCalculation.min_of_list: Return the lowest number in a list of numbers.
layoutCalculation.mod_subcri: Return the remainder after dividing a number by the specified divisor.
layoutCalculation.round_subcri: Return the number closest to the specified number. The new number will be limited to the specified number of digits.
layoutCalculation.sqrt_subcri: Return the positive square roots of the specified number.
layoutCalculation.below_decimal_point: Number of digits after the decimal point

popupSettingField.popupSettingFieldCreateField: Items can be added by drag & drop.
popupSettingField.popupSettingFieldEditField: Items which have not been used can be added.

select_color_label.singer_pulldown_up: If the options go from top to bottom
select_color_label.singer_pulldown_down: If the options go from bottom to top

popup_search_results.message_error_employees_empty: There is no {{0}} matching with the search conditions.

header-search-date.line01: When searching by specifying a range using both start date and end date, the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line02: Example) If the specified range is "2005-01-01 – 2010-12-31"
header-search-date.line03: When searching by specifying a range using start date only, the sheets with dates after that specified date will be searched.
header-search-date.line04: Example) If the specified range is "2005-01-01  - "
header-search-date.line05: When searching by specifying a range using end date only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified date will be searched
header-search-date.line06: Example) If the specified range is " – 2010-12-31"
header-search-date.line07: When searching by specifying a range using both start date and end date, the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line09: Example) if the specified range is "1/1 – 3/31"
header-search-date.line10: If a nonexistent date is specified, it will be automatically replaced by the last day of that month.
header-search-date.line11: (Example: If "2-31"is specified, the date will be corrected to 2-29 for leap years and 2-28 for non-leap years)
header-search-date.line12: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets filled with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line13: ※If the search conditions are saved and used in the following days, the range will be re-vd each time based on that following day.
header-search-date.line14: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) past - 5 (days) next"
header-search-date.line15: When searching by specifying a range using start point only, the sheets with dates after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line16: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) past - "
header-search-date.line17: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line18: Example) If the specified range is " -5 (days) next "
header-search-date.line19: If "Calculate based on calendar days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will also be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line20: If "Calculate based on working days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will not be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line21: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line22: ※If the search conditions are saved and is re-conducted the following days, the range will be re-calculated each time based on that following day.
header-search-date.line23: Example) If the specified range is "5 (days) past - 3 (days) past"
header-search-date.line24: When searching by specifying a range using start point only, the sheets with dates after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line25: Example) If the specified range is "5 (days) past – "
header-search-date.line26: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line27: Example) If the specified range is " – 3 (days) past - "
header-search-date.line28: If "Calculate based on calendar days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will also be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line29: If "Calculate based on working days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will not be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line30: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line31: ※If the search conditions are saved and is re-conducted the following days, the range will be re-calculated each time based on that following day.
header-search-date.line32: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) next - 5 (days) next"
header-search-date.line33: When searching by specifying a range using start point only, the sheets with dates after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line34: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) next – "
header-search-date.line35: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line36: Example) If the specified range is " - 5 (days) next"
header-search-date.line37: If "Calculate based on calendar days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will also be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line38: If "Calculate based on working days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will not be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date.line39: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date.line40: ※If the search conditions are saved and is re-conducted the following days, the range will be re-calculated each time based on that following day.
header-search-date.line41: Example) If the specified range is "3 (months) past – 5 (months) next"
header-search-date.line42: When searching by specifying a range using start point only, the sheets with dates after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line43: Example) If the specified range is "3 (months) past – 5 (months) next"
header-search-date.line44: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date.line45: Example) If the specified range is " – 5 (months) next"
header-search-date.line46: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.

header-search-date.line48: Example) If the specified range is "3 (years) past – 5 (years) next"

header-search-date-time.line01: When searching by specifying a range using both start point and end point (date and time included), the sheets with time within the range will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line02: Example) If the specified range is "9:30 2005/01/01 – 20:15 2010/12/31"
header-search-date-time.line03: When searching by specifying a range using start point only (date and time included), the sheets with time after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line04: Example) If the specified range is "9:30 2005/01/01"
header-search-date-time.line05: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with time prior to that specified point will be searched
header-search-date-time.line06: Example) If the specified range is" – 15:15 2010/12/21"
header-search-date-time.line07: When searching by specifying a range between a start point and an end point (hour and minute included), the sheets with time within the range will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line09: Example) If the specified range is "9:30 - 9:45"
header-search-date-time.line10: If a nonexistent date is specified, it will be automatically replaced by the last day of that month.
header-search-date-time.line11: Example) If the specified range is "2005-01-01 – 2010-12-31"
header-search-date-time.line12: When searching by specifying a range using start date only, the sheets with dates after that specified date will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line13: Example) If the specified range is "2005-01-01 – "
header-search-date-time.line14: When searching by specifying a range using end date only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified date will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line15: Example) If the specified range is " – 2010-12-31"
header-search-date-time.line16: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line17: ※If the search conditions are saved and is re-conducted the following days, the range will be re-calculated each time based on that following day.
header-search-date-time.line18: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) past – 5 (days) next"
header-search-date-time.line19: When searching by specifying a range using start point only, the sheets with dates after that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line20: Example) If the specified range is "3 (days) past – "
header-search-date-time.line21: When searching by specifying a range using end point only, the sheets with dates prior to that specified point will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line22: Example) If the specified range is " – 5 (days) next "
header-search-date-time.line23: If "Calculate based on calendar days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will also be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date-time.line24: If "Calculate based on working days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will not be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
header-search-date-time.line25: The range is calculated based on the current date and the sheets with dates within the range will be searched.
header-search-date-time.line26: ※If the search conditions are saved and is re-conducted the following days, the range will be re-calculated each time based on that following day.
header-search-date-time.line27: Example) If the specified range is "5 (days) past - 3 (days) past"

header-search-date-time.line33: If "Calculate based on working days" is selected, the holidays inbetween will not be counted when calculating the start date and/or the end date of the range.
